timeline.message:
Implement async put
Implement async remove.
Only generate reply if it is a command.

Avoid a race during shutdown that can lead to having to wait 120s extra before completeting shutdown sequence.
This would happen because you could lose the signal sent from the stop method. Now you will either notice that is topped, or you will receive the signal.

timeline.bodyText: Just an observation: a rather far fetched scenario, but since neither of these are now pure virtual it's technically possible for a persistence implementation to override neither of remove or removeAsync, causing infinite recursion here if any of the two are called (same applies to the other sync/async pairings).
timeline.author: vekterli

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that is correct. I will add a comment about that.
I do not think the conformance test will pass in that case :)
replies.author: baldersheim

timeline.bodyText: Consider pulling makeResultTask out above this call to make the code less deeply nested here
timeline.author: vekterli

timeline.message: Add async update and followup on PR comments.

timeline.author: vekterli

timeline.bodyText: Consider adding a comment stating why it's safe to refer to cmd as a reference capture to the argument given to the function itself, since the lifetime semantics aren't necessarily obvious.
timeline.author: vekterli
